pages.text: $(li)Do not forget to put fluid extractors at blocks you want to pump from to get the fluids flowing.$(li)One tank stores 16 buckets of fluid.$(li)16 buckets = 16000mb (millibuckets).$(li)To get fuel out of a tank with a bucket, the tank must have at least ONE bucket (1000mb) of content.

$(li)If you can not see any fluids (in tanks), be reminded that for example, 100mb = 1/10 Minecraft buckets! This is not much and can barely be seen.$(li)Oil mills, blast furnaces and backmix reactors do have an energy storage.$(li)All machines do have an integrated fluid buffer storage.$(li)It is recommended to use fluid filters in fuel extractors to prevent fluid blocking.
$(li)You can connect as many tanks as you wish by placing them side by side.$(li)If you break a tank with fluid, the tank will store the fluid.
